title: Part. motion, given v(t) and s(0). part - d

content.description: A particle moves along a straight line. For 0 ≤ t ≤5 , the velocity of the particle is given by v(t)=-2+(t2+3t)6/5-t3, and the position of the particle is given by s(t). It is known that s(0)=10.
content.question: Is the speed of the particle increasing or decreasing at time t=4? Give a reason for your answer.

frqParts.text: Is the speed of the particle increasing or decreasing at time t=4? Give a reason for your answer.

topic.text: 4.2: Straight-Line Motion - Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
